comment: paths are os.path.join('root_data_dir_name','dir_name', 'filename'), paths should end on '/'

core.comment1: paths are os.path.join('root_data_dir_name','dir_name', 'filename'), paths should end on '/'
core.comment2: human-readable label is used in plotting, machine-readable label in paths or filenames
core.comment3: the link indices (0,1,2, ...) can be used as part of the column_names in the dataframes: pm_id_1 refers to the data of the corresponding list index below.

output.comment: [dir_name, file_name, label], paths are os.path.join('root_data_dir_name','dir_name', 'filename'), paths should end on '/'

project_member_id_list.comment July 19 2022: copied from config_all_3files_whitelist.json. For data and output see OPEN_1sttry.
project_member_id_list.comment: [dir_name, file_name, list(dataset keys)] is the file- and dir-name of the list of project member_ids, which are used to restrict the project member ids in the data_per_user_id.csv and data_per_user_id_date.csv
project_member_id_list.comment2: dataset keys are the ones from 'input' -> 'individual'
project_member_id_list.comment3: [dir_name, file_name] is the dir- and file-name of the output files per user_id respectively (user_id, date)
